text: John Wiedhofft Gough (23 February 1900 - 1976) was a Welsh historian noted for his study of John Locke's political philosophy. Gough was described as an outstanding student whilst at Oxford, achieving a first in both the classics and modern history, in 1922 and 1923, respectively.Stuart Brown (ed.), Dictionary of Twentieth-Century British Philosophers (Bloomsbury, 2005), p. 339. He was a fellow of Oriel College, Oxford and in 1947 was appointed lecturer in modern history. He was awarded a DLitt in 1965.Brown, p. 339. ==Works== *The Social Contract: A Critical Study of its Development (Oxford University Press, 1936; 2nd ed., 1957). *John Locke's Political Philosophy: Eight Studies (Oxford University Press, 1950; 2nd ed., 1973). ==Notes== Category:1900 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Welsh historians Category:Fellows of Oriel College, Oxford Category:20th-century British historians
title: J. W. Gough
